395.sun: It swims as fast as a jet boat. The edges of its wings are sharp and can slice apart drifting ice.

396.moon: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.
396.name: starly
396.sun: They flock in great numbers. Though small, they flap their wings with great power.

397.moon: It lives in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.
397.name: staravia
397.sun: They maintain huge flocks, although fierce scuffles break out between various flocks.

398.moon: When Staravia evolve into Staraptor, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.
398.name: staraptor
398.sun: The muscles in its wings and legs are strong. It can easily fly while gripping a small Pokémon.

399.moon: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.
399.name: bidoof
399.sun: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.

4.moon: From the time is born, a flame burns at the tip of  its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to  go out.
4.name: charmander
4.sun: The flame on its tail indicates Charmander's life  force. If it's healthy, the flame burns brightly.

40.moon: As it inhales, it expands...and expands...and expands. Wigglytuff compete to see which one can inflate itself the most.
40.name: wigglytuff
40.sun: It sheds its fine fur when the seasons change. The fur is gathered and spun into a luxurious yarn.

400.moon: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.
400.name: bibarel
400.sun: It busily makes its nest with stacks of branches and roots it has cut up with its sharp incisors.

401.moon: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.
401.name: kricketot
401.sun: It chats with others using the sounds of its colliding antennae. These sounds are fall hallmarks.

402.moon: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.
402.name: kricketune
402.sun: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.

403.moon: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.
403.name: shinx
403.sun: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.

404.moon: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.
404.name: luxio
404.sun: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.

405.moon: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.
405.name: luxray
405.sun: When its eyes gleam gold, it can spot hiding prey--even those taking shelter behind a wall.

406.moon: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.
406.name: budew
406.sun: When it feels the sun's warm touch, it opens its bud  to release pollen. It lives alongside clear pools.

407.moon: With the movements of a dancer, it strikes with whips that are densely lined with poison thorns.
407.name: roserade
407.sun: Luring prey with a sweet scent, it uses poison whips on its arms to poison, bind, and finish off the prey.

408.moon: In rock layers where Cranidos fossils are found, the fossilized trunks of trees snapped in two are also often found.
408.name: cranidos
408.sun: It lived in jungles around a hundred million years ago. It used its skillful headbutts to combat Aerodactyl.

409.moon: Records exist of a revived fossil that evolved into Rampardos. It proceeded to escape and then destroy a skyscraper with a headbutt.
409.name: rampardos
409.sun: The result of repeated headbutts is a skull grown thick and hard. However, its brain has shrunk in size compared with Cranidos’s.

41.moon: When exposed to sunlight, they suffer burns. The frequency of their ultrasonic waves can differ slightly from colony to colony.
41.name: zubat
41.sun: It sleeps in caves during the day. It has no eyes, so to check its surroundings while flying, it emits ultrasonic waves.

410.moon: This Pokémon lived in primeval jungles. Few enemies would have been willing to square off against its heavily armored face, so it’s thought.
410.name: shieldon
410.sun: Many fossils of this Pokémon have been found, but almost none have shown signs of damage to the face.

411.moon: It lived in the same environments as Rampardos. Their fossils have been found together— seemingly from after they’d fought to the finish.
411.name: bastiodon
411.sun: While it can guard against any sort of attack from the front, it is left without recourse when attacked from behind.

412.moon: If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes the cloak with materials nearby.
412.name: burmy
412.sun: To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.

413.moon: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon's body. The cloak is never shed.
413.name: wormadam plant cloak
413.sun: Its appearance changes depending on where it evolved. The materials on hand become a part of its body.

414.moon: It flutters around at night and steals honey from the Combee hive.
414.name: mothim
414.sun: It loves the honey of flowers and steals honey collected by Combee.

415.moon: It collects and delivers honey to its colony. At night, they cluster to form a beehive and sleep.
415.name: combee
415.sun: The trio is together from birth. It constantly gathers  honey from flowers to please Vespiquen.

416.moon: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by Combee.
416.name: vespiquen
416.sun: It houses its colony in cels in its body and releases various pheromones to make those grubs do its bidding

417.moon: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.
417.name: pachirisu
417.sun: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.

418.moon: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.
418.name: buizel
418.sun: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.

419.moon: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.
419.name: floatzel
419.sun: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.

42.moon: Sometimes they drink so much blood, they can’t fly anymore. Then they fall to the ground and become food for other Pokémon.
42.name: golbat
42.sun: Its thick fangs are hollow like straws, making them unexpectedly fragile. These fangs are specialized for sucking blood.

420.moon: It evolves by sucking the energy out of the small ball where it had been storing nutrients.
420.name: cherubi
420.sun: Sunlight colors it red. When the small ball is drained of nutrients, it shrivels to herald evolution.

421.moon: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun's rays with its whole body.
421.name: cherrim
421.sun: During times of strong sunlight, its bud blooms, its petals open fully, and it becomes very active.

422.moon: Its shape and coloration vary, depending on its habitat.
422.name: shellos
422.sun: Beware of pushing strongly on its squishy body, as it makes a mysterious purple fluid ooze out.

423.moon: It apparently had a huge shell for protection in ancient times. It lives in shallow tidal pools.
423.name: gastrodon
423.sun: When its natural enemy attacks, it oozes purple fluid and escapes.

424.moon: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.
424.name: ambipom
424.sun: They work in large colonies and make rings by linking their tails, apparently in friendship.

425.moon: If for some reason its body bursts, its soul spills out with a screaming sound.
425.name: drifloon
425.sun: Stories go that it grabs the hands of small children and drags them away to the afterlife. It dislikes heavy children.

426.moon: Even while under careful observation, large flocks of Drifblim flying at dusk will inexplicably disappear from view.
426.name: drifblim
426.sun: There was once an incident in which a man took a trip riding a Drifblim, only to go missing.

427.moon: When it senses danger, it perks up its ears. On cold nights, it sleeps with its head tucked into its fur.
427.name: buneary
427.sun: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.

428.moon: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.
428.name: lopunny
428.sun: Extremely cautious, it quickly bounds off when it senses danger.

429.moon: Mismagius have been known to cast spells to make people fall in love, so some people search for this Pokémon as if their life depended on it.
429.name: mismagius
429.sun: It appears as if from nowhere—muttering incantations, placing curses, and giving people terrifying visions.

43.moon: Its scientific name is “Oddium Wanderus.” At night, it is said to walk nearly 1,000 feet on its two roots.
43.name: oddish
43.sun: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

430.moon: If its Murkrow cronies fail to catch food for it, or if it feels they have betrayed it, it will hunt them down wherever they are and punish them.
430.name: honchkrow
430.sun: A single cry from this nocturnal Pokémon, and more than a hundred of its Murkrow cronies will assemble.

431.moon: When it's happy, Glameow demonstrates beautiful movements of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.
431.name: glameow
431.sun: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.

432.moon: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.
432.name: purugly
432.sun: It would claim another Pokémon's nest as its own if it finds a nest sufficiently comfortable.

433.moon: There is an orb inside its mouth. When it hops, the orb bounces all over and makes a ringing sound.
433.name: chingling
433.sun: Each time it hops, it makes a ringing sound. It deafens foes by emitting high-frequency cries.

434.moon: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.
434.name: stunky
434.sun: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.

435.moon: It sprays a stinky fluid from its tail. The fluid smells worse the longer it is allowed to fester.
435.name: skuntank
435.sun: It sprays a vile-smelling fluid from the tip of its tail to attack. Its range is over 160 feet.

436.moon: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.
436.name: bronzor
436.sun: Ancient people believed that the pattern on Bronzor's back contained a mysterious power.

437.moon: Ancient people believed that petitioning Bronzong for rain was the way to make crops grow.
437.name: bronzong
437.sun: In ages past, this Pokémon was revered as a bringer of rain. It was found buried in the ground.

438.moon: From its eyes, it can expel excess moisture from its body. This liquid is similar in composition to human sweat.
438.name: bonsly
438.sun: It does not deal well with water, so it lives in dry locales. Since its surroundings tend to lack greenery, it stands out noticeably.

439.moon: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokémon.
439.name: mime jr.
439.sun: In an attempt to confuse its enemy, it mimics the enemy's movements. Then it wastes no time in making itself scarce!

44.moon: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.
44.name: gloom
44.sun: Smells incredibly foul! However, around one out of a thousand people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.

440.moon: It’s too small to lay eggs yet. As a surrogate, it searches out round white stones.
440.name: happiny
440.sun: It carries a round white rock in its belly pouch. If it gets along well with someone, it will sometimes give that person the rock.

441.moon: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.
441.name: chatot
441.sun: It mimics the cries of other Pokémon to trick them into thinking it's one of them. This way they won't attack  it.

442.moon: It was bound to a fissure in an odd keystone as  punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.
442.name: spiritomb
442.sun: A Pokémon that was formed by 108 spirits. It is bound to a fissure in an odd keystone

443.moon: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.
443.name: gible
443.sun: It lives in caves warmed by geothermal heat. Even so, when the weather gets cold, it will huddle close with others of its kind.

444.moon: Shiny objects are its passion. It can be found in its cave, scarcely moving, its gaze fixed on the jewels it’s amassed or Carbink it has caught.
444.name: gabite
444.sun: In rare cases, it molts and sheds its scales. Medicine containing its scales as an ingredient will make a weary body feel invigorated.

445.moon: It flies at speeds equals to a jet fighter plane. It never allows its prey to escape.
445.name: garchomp
445.sun: When it folds up its body and extends its wings, it looks like a jet plane. It flies at sonic speed.

446.moon: When it finds something that looks like it might be edible, it goes right ahead and swallows it whole. That’s why it gets fatter day by day.
446.name: munchlax
446.sun: It needs to consume its own weight in food every day. As far as flavor is concerned, it’s indifferent.

447.moon: It’s tough enough to run right through the night, and it’s also a hard worker, but it’s still just a youngster.
447.name: riolu
447.sun: It can discern the physical and emotional states of people, Pokémon, and other natural things from the shape of their aura waves.

448.moon: By reading the auras of all things, it can tell how others are feeling from over half a mile away.
448.name: lucario
448.sun: By catching the aura emanating from others, it can read their thoughts and movements.

449.moon: It enshrouds itself with sand to protect itself from germs. It does not enjoy getting wet.
449.name: hippopotas
449.sun: It lives in arid places. Instead of perspiration,  it expels grainy sand from its body.

45.moon: It has the world's largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.
45.name: vileplume
45.sun: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

450.moon: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.
450.name: hippowdon
450.sun: It brandishes its gaping mouth in a display of fearsome strength. It raises vast quantities of sand while attacking.

451.moon: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.
451.name: skorupi
451.sun: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.

452.moon: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.
452.name: drapion
452.sun: It takes pride in its strength. Even though it can tear foes apart, it finishes them off with powerful poison.

453.moon: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.
453.name: croagunk
453.sun: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.

454.moon: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.
454.name: toxicroak
454.sun: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.

455.moon: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.
455.name: carnivine
455.sun: It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.

456.moon: Its double tail fins propel its energetic jumps. When it breaks the surface of the sea, Wingull swoop down to grab it on the fly.
456.name: finneon
456.sun: It absorbs sunlight with the pink areas of its skin, which then shine. This appears to be a form of camouflage.

457.moon: This deep-sea Pokémon lives at the bottom of the sea. Its fins haul it over the seabed in search of its favorite food—Starmie.
457.name: lumineon
457.sun: With its shining light, it lures its prey close. However, the light also happens to attract ferocious fish Pokémon—its natural predators.

458.moon: When it swims close to the surface of the ocean, people aboard ships are able to observe the pattern on its back.
458.name: mantyke
458.sun: The pattern on its back varies by region. It often swims in a school of Remoraid.

459.moon: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.
459.name: snover
459.sun: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain's lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.

46.moon: Mushrooms called tochukaso sprout from its back. They can be dried and powdered to make a medicine used to extend life.
46.name: paras
46.sun: No matter how much it eats, the mushrooms growing on its back steal away most of the nutrients it consumes.

460.moon: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.
460.name: abomasnow
460.sun: It blankets wide areas in snow by whipping up blizzards. It is also known as "The Ice Monster."

461.moon: They dwell in cold places. This Pokémon’s main food source in Alola is Vulpix and Sandshrew, which they carefully divide among their group.
461.name: weavile
461.sun: They travel in groups of four or five, leaving signs for one another on trees and rocks. They bring down their prey with coordinated attacks.

462.moon: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin, while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.
462.name: magnezone
462.sun: Three units generate magnetism. There have been many mistaken reports of UFO sightings when Magnezone flies through the night sky.

463.moon: Their saliva contains lots of components that can dissolve anything. The numbness caused by their lick does not dissipate.
463.name: lickilicky
463.sun: It wraps things with its extensible tongue. Getting too close to it will leave you soaked with drool.

464.moon: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.
464.name: rhyperior
464.sun: From holes in its palms, it fires out Geodude. Its carapace can withstand volcanic eruptions.

465.moon: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can't even see its eyes.
465.name: tangrowth
465.sun: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.

466.moon: When it gets excited, it thumps its chest. With every thud, thunder roars and electric sparks shower all around.
466.name: electivire
466.sun: It pushes the tips of its tails against its foes and then lets loose a high-voltage current. Its foes are burned to a crisp in an instant.

467.moon: From its arm, it launches fireballs hotter than 3,500 degrees Fahrenheit. Its arm starts to melt when it fires a whole barrage.
467.name: magmortar
467.sun: They dwell in volcanic craters. According to what is known, a single pair of male and female Magmortar lives in one volcano.

468.moon: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another's rights and avoid needless strife.
468.name: togekiss
468.sun: As everyone knows, it visits peaceful regions, bringing them gifts of kindness and sweet blessings.

469.moon: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.
469.name: yanmega
469.sun: It prefers to battle by biting apart foes' heads instantly while flying at high speed.

47.moon: It scatters toxic spores from its mushroom cap. Once harvested, these spores can be steeped and boiled down to prepare herbal medicines.
47.name: parasect
47.sun: The large mushroom on its back controls it. It often fights over territory with Shiinotic.

470.moon: The younger they are, the more they smell like fresh grass. With age, their fragrance takes on the odor of fallen leaves.
470.name: leafeon
470.sun: Its cellular composition is closer to that of a plant than an animal. It uses photosynthesis to produce its energy supply without eating food.

471.moon: It freezes its fur into icicles, spiky and sharp, and tackles its prey.
471.name: glaceon
471.sun: It can control its body temperature at will. This enables it to freeze the moisture in the atmosphere, creating flurries of diamond dust.

472.moon: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.
472.name: gliscor
472.sun: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!

473.moon: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.
473.name: mamoswine
473.sun: A frozen Mamoswine was dug from ice dating back 10,000 years. This Pokémon has been around a long, long, long time.

474.moon: Its program was modified to facilitate extra-dimensional activities, but that led to noticeably strange behavior.
474.name: porygon z
474.sun: In order to create a more advanced Pokémon, an additional program was installed, but apparently it contained a defect that makes it move oddly.

475.moon: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on its elbows.
475.name: gallade
475.sun: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.

476.moon: The main body controls three mobile units called Mini-Noses, which it maneuvers to catch prey.
476.name: probopass
476.sun: It radiates such a powerful magnetic field that nearby electrical appliances become unusable.

477.moon: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.
477.name: dusknoir
477.sun: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.

478.moon: The soul of a woman lost on a snowy mountain possessed an icicle, becoming this Pokémon. The food it most relishes is the souls of men.
478.name: froslass
478.sun: When it finds humans or Pokémon it likes, it freezes them and takes them to its chilly den, where they become decorations.

479.moon: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.
479.name: rotom
479.sun: Research continues on this Pokémon, which could be the power source of a unique motor.

48.moon: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats bugs. It is attracted by light at night.
48.name: venonat
48.sun: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.

480.moon: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.
480.name: uxie
480.sun: Known as â€œThe Being of Knowledge.â€ It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.

481.moon: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake's surface.
481.name: mesprit
481.sun: Known as â€œThe Being of Emotion.â€ It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.

482.moon: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit and Azelf all came from the same egg.
482.name: azelf
482.sun: Known as â€œThe Being of Willpower.â€ It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.

483.moon: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.
483.name: dialga
483.sun: A Pokémon spoken of in legend. It is said that time began moving when Dialga was born.

484.moon: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.
484.name: palkia
484.sun: It is said to live in a gap in the spatial dimension parallel to ours. It appears in mythology.

485.moon: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.
485.name: heatran
485.sun: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.

486.moon: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.
486.name: regigigas
486.sun: It is said to have made Pokémon that look like itself from a special ice mountain, rocks, and magma.

487.moon: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.
487.name: giratina altered
487.sun: This Pokémon is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours, where common knowledge is distorted and strange.

488.moon: Those who sleep holding Cresselia's feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
488.name: cresselia
488.sun: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

489.moon: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.
489.name: phione
489.sun: When the water warms, they inflate the flotation sac on their heads and drift languidly on the sea in packs.

49.moon: The wings are covered with dustlike scales. Every time it flaps its wings, it looses highly toxic dust.
49.name: venomoth
49.sun: The scales it scatters will paralyze anyone who touches them, making that person unable to stand.

490.moon: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.
490.name: manaphy
490.sun: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.

491.moon: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.
491.name: darkrai
491.sun: It chases people and Pokémon from its territory by causing them to experience deep, nightmarish slumbers.

492.moon: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.
492.name: shaymin land
492.sun: It can dissolve toxins in the air to instantly transform ruined land into a lush field of flowers.

493.moon: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
493.name: arceus
493.sun: According to the legends of Sinnoh, this Pokémon emerged from an egg and shaped all there is in this world.

494.moon: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being's entire body will be overflowing with power.
494.name: victini
494.sun: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

495.moon: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.
495.name: snivy
495.sun: Being exposed to sunlight makes its movements swifter. It uses vines more adeptly than its hands.

496.moon: When it gets dirty, its leaves can't be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.
496.name: servine
496.sun: It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.

497.moon: It can stop its opponents'movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.
497.name: serperior
497.sun: It only gives its all fighting against strong opponents who are not fazed by the glare from Serperior's noble eyes.

498.moon: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.
498.name: tepig
498.sun: It can deftly dodge its foe's attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

499.moon: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.
499.name: pignite
499.sun: The more it eats, the more fuel it has to make the fire in its stomach stronger. This fills it with even more power.

5.moon: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the air temperature to unbearably high levels.
5.name: charmeleon
5.sun: It lashes about with its tail to knock down its foe.  It then tears up the fallen opponent with  sharp claws.

50.moon: Its skin is very thin. If it is exposed to light, its blood heats up, causing it to grow weak.
50.name: diglett
50.sun: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.

500.moon: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.
500.name: emboar
500.sun: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.

50003.moon: After a rainy day, the flower on its back smells  stronger. The scent attracts other Pokémon.
50003.name: mega venusaur
50003.sun: By spreading the broad petals of its flower and catching the sun's rays, it fills its body with power.

50006.moon: Its wings can carry this Pokémon close to an altitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out fire at very high temperatures.
50006.name: mega charizard y
50006.sun: When expelling a blast of superhot fire, the red flame at the tip of its tail burns more intensely.

50009.moon: The pressurized water jets on this brutal Pokémon's shell are used for high-speed tackles.
50009.name: mega blastoise
50009.sun: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.

50015.moon: May appear in a swarm. Flies at violent speeds, all the while stabbing with the toxic stinger on its rear.
50015.name: mega beedrill
50015.sun: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.

50018.moon: It spreads its gorgeous wings widely to intimidate enemies. It races through the skies at Mach-2 speed.
50018.name: mega pidgeot
50018.sun: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.

50019.moon: Its fangs are long and very sharp. They grow continuously, so it gnaws on hard things to whittle them down.
50019.name: alolan rattata
50019.sun: Living wherever there is food available, it ceaselessly scavenges for edibles the entire day.

50020.moon: The webs on its hind legs enable it to cross rivers. It searches wide areas for food
50020.name: alolan raticate
50020.sun: It whittles its constantly growing fangs by gnawing on hard things. It can chew apart cinder walls.

50026.moon: It can loose 100,000-volt bursts of electricity, instantly downing foes several times its size.
50026.name: alolan raichu
50026.sun: When its electricity builds, its muscles are stimulated, and it becomes more aggressive than usual.

50027.moon: Disliking water, it lives in deep burrows in arid areas. It can roll itself instantly into a ball.
50027.name: alolan sandshrew
50027.sun: It burrows and lives underground. If threatened, it curls itself up into a ball for protection.

50028.moon: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.
50028.name: alolan sandslash
50028.sun: If it digs at an incredible pace, it may snap off its spikes and claws. They grow back in a day.

50037.moon: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.
50037.name: alolan vulpix
50037.sun: When it is born, it has just one snow-white tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.

50038.moon: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.
50038.name: alolan ninetales
50038.sun: It has nine long tales and fur that gleams gold. It is said to live for 1,000 years.

50050.moon: Its skin is very thin. If it is exposed to light, its blood heats up, causing it to grow weak.
50050.name: alolan diglett
50050.sun: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.

50051.moon: Extremely powerful, they can dig through even the hardest ground to a depth of over 60 miles.
50051.name: alolan dugtrio
50051.sun: In battle, it digs through the ground and strikes the unsuspecting foe from an unexpected direction.

50052.moon: Adores round objects. It wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.
50052.name: alolan meowth
50052.sun: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.

50053.moon: Its lithe muscles allow it to walk without making a sound. It attacks in an instant.
50053.name: alolan persian
50053.sun: A very haughty Pokémon. Among fans, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.

50065.moon: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its IQ (intelligence quotient) is said to be around 5,000.
50065.name: mega alakazam
50065.sun: Its brain cells multiply continually until it dies. As a result, it remembers everything.

50074.moon: It is impossible to distinguish from rocks. It slams against others in contests of hardness.
50074.name: alolan geodude
50074.sun: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

50075.moon: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.
50075.name: alolan graveler
50075.sun: With a free and uncaring nature, it doesn't mind if pieces break off while it rolls down mountains.

50076.moon: Even dynamite can't harm its hard, boulder-like body. It sheds its hide just once a year.
50076.name: alolan golem
50076.sun: It tumbles down mountains, leaving grooves from peak to base. Stay clear of these grooves.

50080.moon: When a Slowpoke went hunting in the sea, its tail was bitten by a Shellder. That made it evolve into Slowbro.
50080.name: mega slowbro
50080.sun: An attached Shellder won't let go because of the tasty flavor that oozes out of its tail.

50088.moon: Appears in flithy areas. It thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.
50088.name: alolan grimer
50088.sun: Sludge exposed to X-rays from the moon transformed into Grimer. It loves feeding on filthy things.

50089.moon: A toxic fluid seeps from its body. The fluid instantly kills plants and trees on contact.
50089.name: alolan muk
50089.sun: They love to gather in smelly areas where sludge accumulates, making the stench around  them worse.

50094.moon: Hiding in people's shadows at night, it absorbs their heat. The chill it causes makes the victims shake.
50094.name: mega gengar
50094.sun: It hides in shadows. It is said that if Gengar is hiding, it cools the area by nearly 10 degrees Fahrenheit.

501.moon: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.
501.name: oshawott
501.sun: The scalchop on its stomach isn't just used for battle--it can be used to break open hard berries as well.

50103.moon: It is called "The Walking Jungle." If a head grows  too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute.
50103.name: alolan exeggutor
50103.sun: Its three heads think independently. However, they are friendly and never appear to squabble.

50105.moon: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets.
50105.name: alolan marowak
50105.sun: It is small and was originally very weak. Its temperament turned ferocious when it began using bones.

50115.moon: If it is safe, the young gets out of the belly pouch to play. The adult keeps a close eye on the youngster.
50115.name: mega kangaskhan
50115.sun: It raises its offspring in its belly pouch. It lets the baby out to play only when it feels safe.

50127.moon: It swings its long pincer horns wildly to attack.  During cold periods, it hides deep in forests.
50127.name: mega pinsir
50127.sun: It grips prey with its pincers until the prey is torn in half. What it can't tear, it tosses far.

50130.moon: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.
50130.name: mega gyarados
50130.sun: In ancient literature, there is a record of a Gyarados that razed a village when violence flared.

50142.moon: This vicious Pokémon is said to have flown in ancient skies while shrieking high-pitched cries.
50142.name: mega aerodactyl
50142.sun: It was regenerated from a dinosaur's genetic matter that was found in amber. It flies with high-pitched cries.

50150.moon: A Pokémon created by recombining Mew's genes. It's said to have the most savage heart among Pokémon.
50150.name: mega mewtwo y
50150.sun: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA-engineering experiments.

50181.moon: The tail's tip shines brightly and can be seen from  far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.
50181.name: mega ampharos
50181.sun: The tail's tip shines brightly and can be seen from far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.

502.moon: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.
502.name: dewott
502.sun: Strict training is how it learns its flowing double-scalchop technique.

50201.moon: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.
50201.name: unown ?
50201.sun: Its flat, thin body is always stuck on walls. Its shape appears to have some meaning.

50208.moon: It chews its way through boulders with its sturdy jaws. Its eyes can see in the darkness underground.
50208.name: mega steelix
50208.sun: Tempered underground under high pressure and heat, its body is harder than any metal.

50212.moon: It has a steel-hard body. It intimidates foes by upraising its eye-patterned pincers.
50212.name: mega scizor
50212.sun: This Pokémon's pincers, which contain steel, can crush any hard object it gets ahold of into bits.

50214.moon: With its Herculean powers, it can easily throw around an object that is 100 times its own weight.
50214.name: mega heracross
50214.sun: This powerful Pokémon thrusts its prized horn under its enemies' bellies, then lifts and throws them.

50229.moon: The flames it breathes when angry contain toxins.  If they cause a burn, it will hurt forever.
50229.name: mega houndoom
50229.sun: Long ago, people imagined its eerie howls to be the call of the grim reaper.

50248.moon: If it rampages, it knocks down mountains and buries  rivers. Maps must be redrawn afterward.
50248.name: mega tyranitar
50248.sun: In just one of its mighty hands, it has the power to make the ground shake and mountains crumble.

50254.moon: It agilely leaps about the jungle and uses the sharp leaves on its arms to strike its prey.
50254.name: mega sceptile
50254.sun: The leaves on its forelegs are as sharp as swords. It agilely leaps about the branches of trees to strike.

50257.moon: When facing a tough foe, it looses flames from its wrists. Its powerful legs it jump clear over buildings.
50257.name: mega blaziken
50257.sun: It can clear a 30-story building in a leap. Its fiery punches scorch its foes.

50260.moon: It can swim while towing a large ship. It bashes down foes with a swing of its thick arms.
50260.name: mega swampert
50260.sun: Its arms are rock-hard. With one swing, they can batter down its foe. It makes its nest on beautiful beaches.

50282.moon: It has the power to predict the future. Its power peaks when it is protecting its Trainer.
50282.name: mega gardevoir
50282.sun: To protect its Trainer, it will expend all its psychic power to create a small black hole.

503.moon: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.
503.name: samurott
503.sun: In the time it takes a foe to blink, it can draw and sheathe the seamitars attached to its front legs.

50302.moon: It dwells in the darkness of caves. It uses its sharp claws to dig up gems to nourish itself.
50302.name: mega sableye
50302.sun: It hides in the darkness of caves. Its diet of gems has transformed its eyes into gemstones.

50303.moon: Attached to its head is a huge set of jaws formed by horns. It can chew through iron beams.
50303.name: mega mawile
50303.sun: It uses its docile-looking face to lull foes into complacency, then bites with its huge, relentless jaws.

50306.moon: While seeking iron for food, it digs tunnels by  breaking through bedrock with its steel horns.
50306.name: mega aggron
50306.sun: It claims an entire mountain as its own. The more wounds it has, the more it has battled, so don't take it lightly.

50308.moon: Through yoga training, it gained the psychic power to predict its foe's next move.
50308.name: mega medicham
50308.sun: It elegantly avoids attacks with dance-like steps, then launches a devastating blow in the  same motion.

50310.moon: It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a thundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.
50310.name: mega manectric
50310.sun: It rarely appears before people. It is said to nest where lightning has fallen.

50319.moon: It can swim at speeds of 75 mph by jetting seawater through its body. It is the bandit of the sea.
50319.name: mega sharpedo
50319.sun: Its fangs rip through sheet iron. It swims at 75 mph and is known as "The Bully of the Sea."

50323.moon: If angered, the humps on its back erupt in a shower of molten lava. It lives in the craters of volcanoes.
50323.name: mega camerupt
50323.sun: The volcanoes on its back have a major eruption every 10 years--or whenever it becomes really angry.

50334.moon: On sunny days, it flies freely through the sky and  blends into the clouds. It sings in a  beautiful soprano.
50334.name: mega altaria
50334.sun: It flies gracefully through the sky. Its melodic humming makes you feel like you're in a dream.

50354.moon: Strong feelings of hatred turned a puppet into a Pokémon. If it opens its mouth, its cursed energy escapes.
50354.name: mega banette
50354.sun: A doll that became a Pokémon over its grudge from being junked. It seeks the child that disowned it.

50359.moon: It appears when it senses an impending natural disaster. As a result, it was mistaken as a doom bringer.
50359.name: mega absol
50359.sun: It senses coming disasters and appears before people only to warn them of impending danger.

50362.moon: It can instantly freeze moisture in the atmosphere. It uses this power to freeze its foes.
50362.name: mega glalie
50362.sun: To protect itself, it clad its body in an armor of ice, made by freezing moisture in the air.

50373.moon: It's uncontrollable if enraged. It flies around spouting flames and scorching fields and mountains.
50373.name: mega salamence
50373.sun: It becomes uncontrollable if it is enraged. It destroys everything with shredding claws and fire.

50376.moon: Metang combined to form it. With four brains, it has the intelligence of a supercomputer.
50376.name: mega metagross
50376.sun: With four linked brains, it's more intelligent than a supercomputer, and it uses calculations to analyze foes.

50380.moon: Its body is covered with a down that can refract light in such a way that it becomes invisible.
50380.name: mega latias
50380.sun: It communicates using telepathy. Its body is covered in down that refracts light to make it invisible.

50381.moon: It understands human speech and is highly intelligent. It is a tender Pokémon that dislikes fighting.
50381.name: mega latios
50381.sun: A highly intelligent Pokémon. By folding back its wings in flight, it can overtake jet planes.

50382.moon: It is said to have widened the seas by causing downpours. It had been asleep in a marine trench.
50382.name: primal kyogre
50382.sun: A mythical Pokémon said to have swelled the seas with rain and tidal waves. It battled with Groudon

50383.moon: It had been asleep in underground magma ever since it fiercely fought Kyogre long ago.
50383.name: primal groudon
50383.sun: Said to have expanded the lands by evaporating water with raging heat. It battled titanically with Kyogre

50384.moon: It flies in the ozone layer, way up high in the sky. Until recently, no one had ever seen it.
50384.name: mega rayquaza
50384.sun: It lives in the ozone layer far above the clouds and cannot be seen from the ground.

50386.moon: DNA from a space virus mutated and became a Pokémon. It appears where auroras are seen.
50386.name: deoxys speed
50386.sun: An alien virus that fell to earth on a meteor underwent a DNA mutation to become this Pokémon.

504.moon: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won't notice a foe coming from behind.
504.name: patrat
504.sun: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watch for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.

50413.moon: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon's body. The cloak is never shed.
50413.name: wormadam trash cloak
50413.sun: Its appearance changes depending on where it evolved. The materials on hand become a part of its body.

50428.moon: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.
50428.name: mega lopunny
50428.sun: Extremely cautious, it quickly bounds off when it senses danger.

50445.moon: It flies at speeds equals to a jet fighter plane. It never allows its prey to escape.
50445.name: mega garchomp
50445.sun: When it folds up its body and extends its wings, it looks like a jet plane. It flies at sonic speed.

50448.moon: By reading the auras of all things, it can tell how others are feeling from over half a mile away.
50448.name: mega lucario
50448.sun: By catching the aura emanating from others, it can read their thoughts and movements.

50460.moon: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.
50460.name: mega abomasnow
50460.sun: It blankets wide areas in snow by whipping up blizzards. It is also known as "The Ice Monster."

50475.moon: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on its elbows.
50475.name: mega gallade
50475.sun: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.

50479.moon: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.
50479.name: rotom mow
50479.sun: Research continues on this Pokémon, which could be the power source of a unique motor.

50487.moon: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.
50487.name: giratina origin
50487.sun: This Pokémon is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours, where common knowledge is distorted and strange.

50492.moon: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.
50492.name: shaymin sky
50492.sun: It can dissolve toxins in the air to instantly transform ruined land into a lush field of flowers.

505.moon: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.
505.name: watchog
505.sun: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.

50531.moon: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.
50531.name: mega audino
50531.sun: Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch.

50550.moon: Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along, but sometimes members of one school mingle with the other's school.
50550.name: basculin blue striped
50550.sun: Red- and blue-striped Basculin are very violent and always fighting. They are also remarkably tasty.

50555.moon: Its internal fire burns at 2,500° F, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.
50555.name: darmanitan zen mode
50555.sun: When one is injured in a fierce battle, it hardens into a stone-like form. Then it meditates and sharpens its mind.

506.moon: The long fur surrounding its face functions as radar, enabling it to probe the condition of its battle opponents.
506.name: lillipup
506.sun: Because it doesn’t yelp, it’s extremely popular with Trainers who live in apartment buildings.

50641.moon: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.
50641.name: tornadus therian
50641.sun: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.

50642.moon: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.
50642.name: thundurus therian
50642.sun: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.

50645.moon: From the forces of lightning and wind, it creates energy to give nutrients to the soil and make the land abundant.
50645.name: landorus therian
50645.sun: Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as “The Guardian of the Fields."

50646.moon: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.
50646.name: kyurem white
50646.sun: This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.

50648.moon: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.
50648.name: meloetta pirouette
50648.sun: The melodies sung by Meloetta have the power to make Pokémon that hear them happy or sad.

50658.moon: It appears and vanishes with a ninja's grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.
50658.name: greninja ash
50658.sun: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.

50670.moon: When the flowers of a well-tended flower bed bloom, it appears and celebrates with an elegant dance.
50670.name: floette eternal
50670.sun: It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for flowers that are starting to wilt. It draws out the hidden power of flowers to battle.

50678.moon: The eyeball patterns on the interior of its ears emit psychic energy. It keeps the patterns tightly covered because that power is too immense.
50678.name: meowstic female
50678.sun: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck into dust.

50681.moon: Apparently, it can detect innate qualities of leadership. According to legend, whoever it recognizes is destined to become king.
50681.name: aegislash blade
50681.sun: Generations of kings were attended by these Pokémon, which used their spectral power to manipulate and control people and Pokémon.

507.moon: This Pokémon obeys its master’s orders faithfully. However, it refuses to listen to anything said by a person it doesn’t respect.
507.name: herdier
507.sun: Its dense black fur grows continuously. The high cost of keeping its hard fur properly groomed makes this a troublesome Pokémon to train.

50710.moon: It is said to carry wandering spirits to the place where they belong so they can move on.
50710.name: pumpkaboo super
50710.sun: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.

50711.moon: It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms. It sings joyfully as it observes the suffering of its prey.
50711.name: gourgeist super
50711.sun: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.

50718.moon: It's hypothesized that it's monitoring those who destroy the ecosystem from deep in the cave where it lives.
50718.name: zygarde complete 100% 100
50718.sun: When the Kalos region's ecosystem falls into disarray, it appears and reveals its secret power.

50719.moon: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.
50719.name: mega diancie
50719.sun: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.

50720.moon: This troublemaker sends anything and everything to faraway places using its loop, which can warp space
50720.name: hoopa unbound
50720.sun: It gathers things it likes and pushes them through its loop to teleport them to a secret place.

50745.moon: When properly raised from a young age, it will become a trustworthy partner that will absolutely never betray its Trainer.
50745.name: lycanroc dusk
50745.sun: Its quick movements confuse its enemies. Well equipped with claws and fangs, it also uses the sharp rocks in its mane as weapons.

50746.moon: Itâ€™s awfully weak and notably tasty, so everyone is always out to get it. As it happens, anyone trying to bully it receives a painful lesson.
50746.name: wishiwashi school
50746.sun: When itâ€™s in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.

50774.moon: Strong impacts can knock it out of its shell. This Pokémon was born from mutated nanoparticles.
50774.name: minior core
50774.sun: Originally making its home in the ozone layer, it hurtles to the ground when the shell enclosing its body grows too heavy.

508.moon: With this wise Pokémon, there could be no concern that it would ever attack people. Some parents even trust it to babysit.
508.name: stoutland
508.sun: Intelligent, good-natured, and valiant, it’s a trustworthy partner on rescue teams.

50800.moon: Light is apparently the source of its energy. It has an extraordinarily vicious disposition and is constantly firing off laser beams.
50800.name: ultra necrozma
50800.sun: Reminiscent of the Ultra Beasts, this life-form, apparently asleep underground, is thought to have come from another world in ancient times.

509.moon: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can't help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.
509.name: purrloin
509.sun: Its cute act is a ruse. When victims let down their guard, they find their items taken, It attacks with sharp claws.

51.moon: Extremely powerful, they can dig through even the hardest ground to a depth of over 60 miles.
51.name: dugtrio
51.sun: In battle, it digs through the ground and strikes the unsuspecting foe from an unexpected direction.

510.moon: Stealthily, it sneaks up on its target, striking from behind before its victim has a chance to react.
510.name: liepard
510.sun: Their beautiful form comes from the muscles they have developed. They run silently in the night.

511.moon: It's good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It's kind enough to share them with friends.
511.name: pansage
511.sun: It shares the leaf on its head with weary-looking Pokémon. These leaves are known to relieve stress.

512.moon: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.
512.name: simisage
512.sun: It attacks enemies with strikes of its thorn-covered tail. This Pokémon is wild tempered.

513.moon: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.
513.name: pansear
513.sun: Very intelligent, it roasts berries before eating them. It likes to help people.

514.moon: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.
514.name: simisear
514.sun: A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.

515.moon: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.
515.name: panpour
515.sun: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. It waters plants with it using its tail.

516.moon: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.
516.name: simipour
516.sun: The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.

517.moon: It eats the dreams of people and Pokémon. When it eats a pleasant dream, it expels pink-colored mist.
517.name: munna
517.sun: This Pokémon appears before people and Pokémon who are having nightmares and eats those dreams.

518.moon: The dream mist coming from its forehead changes into many different colors depending on the dream that was eaten.
518.name: musharna
518.sun: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon.

519.moon: These Pokémon live in cities. They are accustomed to people. Flocks often gather in parks and plazas.
519.name: pidove
519.sun: This very forgetful Pokémon will wait for a new order from its Trainer even though it already has one.

52.moon: Adores round objects. It wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.
52.name: meowth
52.sun: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.

520.moon: No matter where in the world it goes, it knows where its nest is, so it never gets seperated from its Trainer.
520.name: tranquill
520.sun: Many people believe that, deep in the forest where Tranquill live, there is a peaceful place where there is no war.

521.moon: Males have plumage on their heads. They will never let themselves feel close to anyone other than their Trainers.
521.name: unfezant
521.sun: Males swing their head plumage to threaten opponents. The females' flying abilities surpass those of the males.

522.moon: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.
522.name: blitzle
522.sun: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.

523.moon: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.
523.name: zebstrika
523.sun: When this ill-tempered Pokémon runs wild, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.

524.moon: The hexagonal cavity is its ear. It walks in the direction of sounds it hears, but if the sounds cease, it panics and topples over.
524.name: roggenrola
524.sun: Born deep within the ground, it compares itself with similar species, such as Geodude and Carbink, to settle which has the hardest body.

525.moon: It explores caves in search of underground water. It’s not comfortable around water, so this Pokémon takes great care in lapping it up.
525.name: boldore
525.sun: Its orange crystal is a mass of energy. Just one crystal fragment would provide enough fuel for a hundred dump trucks.

526.moon: Known for its hefty horsepower, this Pokémon is a popular partner for construction workers.
526.name: gigalith
526.sun: The blasts of energy it makes from sunbeams have terrifying power. However, it’s not able to fire its blasts at night or on rainy days.

527.moon: The heart-shaped mark left on a body after a Woobat has been attached to it is said to bring good fortune.
527.name: woobat
527.sun: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits  ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.

528.moon: Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male experiences a positive mood shift.
528.name: swoobat
528.sun: It shakes its tail vigorously when it emits ultrasonic waves strong enough to reduce concrete to rubble.

529.moon: By spinning its body, it can dig straight through the ground at a speed of 30 mph.
529.name: drilbur
529.sun: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.

53.moon: Its lithe muscles allow it to walk without making a sound. It attacks in an instant.
53.name: persian
53.sun: A very haughty Pokémon. Among fans, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.

530.moon: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.
530.name: excadrill
530.sun: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.

531.moon: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.
531.name: audino
531.sun: Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch.

532.moon: Always carrying squared logs, they help out with construction. As they grow, they carry bigger logs.
532.name: timburr
532.sun: These Pokémon appear at building sites and help out with construction. They always carry squared logs.

533.moon: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.
533.name: gurdurr
533.sun: With strengthened bodies, they skillfully wield steel beams to take down buildings.

534.moon: Rather than rely on force, they master moves that utilize the centrifugal force of spinning concrete.
534.name: conkeldurr
534.sun: It is thought that Conkeldurr taught humans how to make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.

535.moon: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of these sounds to talk.
535.name: tympole
535.sun: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans and warns others of danger.

536.moon: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.
536.name: palpitoad
536.sun: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.

537.moon: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.
537.name: seismitoad
537.sun: It increases the power of its punches by vibrating the bumps on its fists. It can turn a boulder to rubble with one punch.

538.moon: When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.
538.name: throh
538.sun: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts

539.moon: Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.
539.name: sawk
539.sun: Desiring the strongest karate chop, they seclude themselves in mountains and train without sleeping.

54.moon: This Pokémon is troubled by constant headaches. The more pain it’s in, the more powerful its psychokinesis becomes.
54.name: psyduck
54.sun: As a result of headaches so fierce they cause it to cry, it sometimes uses psychokinesis without meaning to.

540.moon: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.
540.name: sewaddle
540.sun: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.

541.moon: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.
541.name: swadloon
541.sun: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.

542.moon: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.
542.name: leavanny
542.sun: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves by using the sticky silk secreted from its mouth.

543.moon: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.
543.name: venipede
543.sun: It discovers what is going on around it by using the feelers on its head and tail. It is brutally aggressive.

544.moon: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.
544.name: whirlipede
544.sun: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.

545.moon: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.
545.name: scolipede
545.sun: It clasps its prey with the claws on its neck until it stops moving. Then it finishes it off with deadly poison.

546.moon: Pillows and beds stuffed with cotton exhaled by Cottonee are soft and puffy, light and airy— altogether top quality.
546.name: cottonee
546.sun: When it finds others of its kind, they all stick together. When enough of them have collected, the mass resembles a cumulonimbus cloud.

547.moon: This Pokémon appears, riding upon the wind. But if the wind gusts up, it’ll blow the cotton on this Pokémon’s head clean off.
547.name: whimsicott
547.sun: It rides on the wind and slips into people’s homes. After it has turned a room into a cotton- filled mess, it giggles to itself and takes off.

548.moon: By pruning the leaves on its head with regularity, this Pokémon can be grown into a fine plump shape.
548.name: petilil
548.sun: Although the leaves on its head are bitter enough to cause dizziness, they provide relief from weariness—even more so when boiled.

549.moon: As soon as it finds a male to be its partner, the beautiful flower on its head darkens, droops, and withers away.
549.name: lilligant
549.sun: No matter how much time and money is spent raising it, its flowers are the most beautiful when they bloom in the wild.

55.moon: It swims along the banks of lakes and catches fish Pokémon. It takes them to the shore and quietly eats them up.
55.name: golduck
55.sun: It is said that the red part of its forehead grants supernatural powers to those who possess one, so it was over-hunted in the past.

550.moon: Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along, but sometimes members of one school mingle with the other's school.
550.name: basculin red striped
550.sun: Red- and blue-striped Basculin are very violent and always fighting. They are also remarkably tasty.

551.moon: It conceals itself in the sand and chomps down on the legs of any prey that unwarily walk over it. Its favorite food is Trapinch.
551.name: sandile
551.sun: It submerges itself in sand and moves as if swimming. This wise behavior keeps its enemies from finding it and maintains its temperature.

552.moon: Thanks to the special membrane covering its eyes, it can see its surroundings clearly, even in the middle of the night.
552.name: krokorok
552.sun: They move in groups of a few individuals. A female is often the leader of the group, and the males will gather food.

553.moon: After clamping down with its powerful jaws, it twists its body around to rip its prey in half.
553.name: krookodile
553.sun: Its unique faculty of sight can detect small prey more than 30 miles away, even in the midst of a sandstorm.

554.moon: When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its body and its internal fire goes down to 1,100 F.
554.name: darumaka
554.sun: Darumaka's droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.

555.moon: Its internal fire burns at 2,500° F, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.
555.name: darmanitan
555.sun: When one is injured in a fierce battle, it hardens into a stone-like form. Then it meditates and sharpens its mind.

556.moon: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.
556.name: maractus
556.sun: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds

557.moon: When it finds a stone of a suitable size, it secretes a liquid from its mouth to open up a hole to crawl into.
557.name: dwebble
557.sun: It makes a hole in a suitable rock. If that rock breaks, the Pokémon remains agitated until it locates a replacement.

558.moon: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.
558.name: crustle
558.sun: It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when crossing arid land.

559.moon: Proud of its sturdy skull, it suddenly headbutts everything, but its weight makes it unstable, too.
559.name: scraggy
559.sun: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.

56.moon: Its raging tires it out and causes it to fall asleep, but the anger resonating in its dreams causes it to wake up—which infuriates it all over again.
56.name: mankey
56.sun: It can spontaneously become enraged. Everyone near it clears out as it rampages, and the resulting loneliness makes it angrier still.

560.moon: It can smash concrete blocks with its kicking attacks. The one with the biggest crest is the group leader.
560.name: scrafty
560.sun: It pulls up its shed skin to protect itself while it kicks. The bigger the crest, the more respected it is.

561.moon: The guardians of an ancient city, they always fly the same route while keeping watch for invaders.
561.name: sigilyph
561.sun: The guardians of an ancient city, they use their psychic power to attack enemies that invade their territory.

562.moon: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.
562.name: yamask
562.sun: These Pokémon arose from the spirits of people interred in graves. Each retains memories of its former life.

563.moon: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.
563.name: cofagrigus
563.sun: It has been said that they swallow those who get too close and turn them into mummies. They like to eat gold nuggets.

564.moon: Reputed to be the ancestor of most turtle Pokémon, it lived in warm seas approximately a hundred million years ago.
564.name: tirtouga
564.sun: Based on studies of its skeletal structure, it can apparently dive to ocean depths of over half a mile.

565.moon: Active both on land and in the sea, this Pokémon drags its land-based prey into the water to finish it off.
565.name: carracosta
565.sun: It constructed its sturdy shell by crunching and swallowing the hard shells or bones of its prey.

566.moon: To all appearances flightless, it was able to glide down from tall treetops to snag its prey.
566.name: archen
566.sun: It is the ancestor of all bird Pokémon. Archen itself could not actually fly but moved by hopping from treetop to treetop.

567.moon: They hunted in flocks. When one Archeops had the prey cornered, another would swoop on it.
567.name: archeops
567.sun: Although apparently able to fly, they tended to run along the ground, averaging speeds of roughly 25 mph.

568.moon: It gorges on trash until its stomach is full. Then it belches toxic gas. An unlucky whiff of gas will put a person in the hospital.
568.name: trubbish
568.sun: Unsanitary places are what they like best. They can be spotted in Alola, often with Grimer in hot pursuit.

569.moon: For a time, their numbers increased explosively in Alola. Since the arrival of Grimer, their population has decreased dramatically.
569.name: garbodor
569.sun: Beware the poisonous liquid it shoots from its right arm. If even a little of it gets on you, you’ll experience the effects of the unidentified toxin.

57.moon: Some researchers theorize that Primeape remains angry even when inside a Poké Ball.
57.name: primeape
57.sun: It has been known to become so angry that it dies as a result. Its face looks peaceful in death, however.

570.moon: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.
570.name: zorua
570.sun: It changes so it looks like its foe, tricks it, and then uses that opportunity to flee.

571.moon: Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong.  It protects the safety of its pack by tricking  its opponents.
571.name: zoroark
571.sun: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.

572.moon: These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.
572.name: minccino
572.sun: Minccino greet each other by grooming one another thoroughly with their tails

573.moon: Cinccino's body is coated in a special oil that helps it deflect attacks, such as punches.
573.name: cinccino
573.sun: Their white fur feels amazing to touch. Their fur repels dust and prevents static electricity from building up.

574.moon: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.
574.name: gothita
574.sun: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.

575.moon: According to many old tales, it creates friends for itself by controlling sleeping children on starry nights.
575.name: gothorita
575.sun: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.

576.moon: They can predict the future from the placement and movement of the stars. They can see Trainers' life spans.
576.name: gothitelle
576.sun: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.

577.moon: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.
577.name: solosis
577.sun: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they are fine in any environment, no matter how severe.

578.moon: When their two divided brains think the same thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.
578.name: duosion
578.sun: Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.

579.moon: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.
579.name: reuniclus
579.sun: They use psychic power to control their arms, which are made of a special liquid. They can crush boulders psychically.

58.moon: It looks cute, but when you approach another Trainer’s Growlithe, it will bark at you and bite.
58.name: growlithe
58.sun: It’s both clever and loyal, but if a stranger tries to invade its territory, it barks threateningly.

580.moon: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they  dive underwater.
580.name: ducklett
580.sun: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.

581.moon: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.
581.name: swanna
581.sun: Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles.

582.moon: It feels pleasantly cool when embraced. This Pokémon is treasured by households in warm regions.
582.name: vanillite
582.sun: Born of an icicle, this Pokémon uses its frosty breath to make ice crystals, causing snow to fall.

583.moon: This Pokémon has existed since the Ice Age. It controls particles of ice, freezes its opponents, and then shatters them with a headbutt.
583.name: vanillish
583.sun: Hot days cause its body to melt. It can be restored by refreezing it, but the process leaves its body slightly warped.

584.moon: Even if it loses one of its heads, it can live relatively problem-free. It makes snow clouds inside its body.
584.name: vanilluxe
584.sun: Each of its two heads has a brain, and when they are in agreement, it attacks its enemies by exhaling a violent blizzard.

585.moon: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon's fur. People use it to mark the seasons.
585.name: deerling
585.sun: Their coloring changes according to the season and can be slightly affected by the temperature and humidity as well.

586.moon: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.
586.name: sawsbuck
586.sun: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck's horns

587.moon: It grills berries and bug Pokémon with electric shocks and makes a meal of them. It usually nests in the holes gouged in trees by Pikipek.
587.name: emolga
587.sun: It glides using its cape-like membrane. Electrical energy scatters from it, shocking its friends and foes alike.

588.moon: For some reason they evolve when they receive electrical energy while they are attacking Shelmet.
588.name: karrablast
588.sun: These mysterious Pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.

589.moon: These Pokémon evolve by wearing the shell covering of a Shelmet. The steel armor protects their whole body.
589.name: escavalier
589.sun: Wearing the shell covering they stole from Shelmet, they defend themselves and attack with two lances.

59.moon: The fire burning inside its body serves as the energy to fuel it as it runs great distances. It appears in many legends.
59.name: arcanine
59.sun: Overflowing with beauty and majesty, this strong Pokémon appears in ancient Eastern folklore.

590.moon: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball, then releases poison spores.
590.name: foongus
590.sun: It lures people in with its Poké Ball pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.

591.moon: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.
591.name: amoonguss
591.sun: They show off their Poké Ball caps to lure prey, but very few Pokémon are fooled by this.

592.moon: If its veil-like arms stun and wrap a foe, that foe will be dragged miles below the surface, never to return.
592.name: frillish
592.sun: They paralyze prey with poison, then drag them down to their lairs, five miles below the surface.

593.moon: The fate of the ships and crew that wander into Jellicent's habitat: all sunken, all lost, all vanished.
593.name: jellicent
593.sun: Its body is mostly seawater. It's said there's a castle of ships Jellicent have sunk on the seafloor.

594.moon: They float upon the open sea. Many water Pokémon gather in the area around Alomomola.
594.name: alomomola
594.sun: It uses its special mucus to close the wounds of injured Pokémon. The reason for this behavior remains unknown.

595.moon: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorbs static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.
595.name: joltik
595.sun: Since it can't generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokémon and absorbs static electricity.

596.moon: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.
596.name: galvantula
596.sun: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.

597.moon: It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging to the ceiling. It shoots spikes when in danger.
597.name: ferroseed
597.sun: When threatened, it attacks by shooting a barrage of spikes, which gives it a chance to escape by rolling away.

598.moon: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.
598.name: ferrothorn
598.sun: By swinging around its three spiky feelers and shooting spikes, it can obliterate an opponent.

599.moon: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.
599.name: klink
599.sun: Interlocking two bodies and spinning around generates the energy they need to live.

6.moon: Its wings can carry this Pokémon close to an altitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out fire at very high temperatures.
6.name: charizard
6.sun: When expelling a blast of superhot fire, the red flame at the tip of its tail burns more intensely.

60.moon: It’s still not very good at walking. Its Trainers should train this Pokémon to walk every day.
60.name: poliwag
